SqlMetaData.summary: Specifies and retrieves metadata information from parameters and columns of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

example.para: The following example shows the creation of several objects, which describe the column metadata of a record, and the creation of a . The column values of the are set and the is sent to the calling program using the class.

ctor.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

ctorNameDbType.param: The SQL Server type of the parameter or column.
ctorNameDbType.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name and type.

remarks.para: Only the following are allowed to be passed to this constructor as : , , , , , , , Numeric, , , , , , , .

example.para: The following example creates a new object by specifying the column name and a column data type of

ctorNameDbType.exception: A that is not allowed was passed to the constructor as .

ctorNameDbTypeMaxLength.param: The SQL Server type of the parameter or column.
The maximum length of the specified type.
ctorNameDbTypeMaxLength.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name, type, and maximum length.

remarks.para: Only the following are allowed to be passed to the constructor as : , , , , , , , , .
Only a specification of , or -1 is allowed for a of , , or .
For a of , , or , a length specification of , or -1, declares the metadata as VARCHAR(MAX), NVARCHAR(MAX), or NVARBINARY(MAX), respectively.
The following are the default values assigned to , depending on the (the , , , and properties are set to ):

example.para: The following example creates a new object by specifying the column name, a column data type of , and a maximum length of 12 characters.

ctorNameDbTypeUseServerDefaultIsUniqueKe.param: The SQL Server type of the parameter or column.
Specifies whether this column should use the default server value.
Specifies if the column in the table-valued parameter is unique.
Specifies the sort order for a column.
Specifies the ordinal of the sort column.
ctorNameDbTypeUseServerDefaultIsUniqueKe.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name, and default server. This form of the constructor supports table-valued parameters by allowing you to specify if the column is unique in the table-valued parameter, the sort order for the column, and the ordinal of the sort column.
ctorNameDbTypeUseServerDefaultIsUniqueKe.remarks: For more information, see Table-Valued Parameters.

Adjust.summary: Validates the specified value against the metadata, and adjusts the value if necessary.

AdjustValue1.param: The value to validate against the instance.
AdjustValue1.summary: Validates the specified value against the metadata, and adjusts the value if necessary.
AdjustValue1.exception: does not match the type, or could not be adjusted.

CompareOptions.summary: Gets the comparison rules used for the column or parameter.
CompareOptions.value: The comparison rules used for the column or parameter as a .

DbType.summary: Gets the data type of the column or parameter.
DbType.value: The data type of the column or parameter as a .

InferFromValue.param: The object used from which the metadata is inferred.
The name assigned to the returned instance.
InferFromValue.summary: Infers the metadata from the specified object and returns it as a instance.
InferFromValue.returns: The inferred metadata as a instance.

IsUniqueKey.summary: Indicates if the column in the table-valued parameter is unique.

remarks.para: The default is .
This property can only be set in one of the constructors.
For more information, see Table-Valued Parameters.

LocaleId.summary: Gets the locale ID of the column or parameter.
LocaleId.value: The locale ID of the column or parameter as a .

remarks.para: The default value is the current locale of the current thread for string-valued s, and 0 for s that do not support collation.
Returns 0 if the collation of the underlying column type is not defined.

Max.summary: Gets the length of TEXT, NTEXT, and IMAGE data types.
Max.value: The length of TEXT, NTEXT, and IMAGE data types.

MaxLength.summary: Gets the maximum length of the column or parameter.
MaxLength.value: The maximum length of the column or parameter as a .

remarks.para: The potential maximum length for values of the specified column. Returns 0 for types other than fixed and varying length character and binary types. For variable size columns or parameters declared with the Max constructor parameter, it returns -1.
For Row this returns the number of columns in the row metadata instance.
The default value is 0.

Name.summary: Gets the name of the column or parameter.
Name.value: The name of the column or parameter as a .

Precision.summary: Gets the precision of the column or parameter.
Precision.value: The precision of the column or parameter as a .
Precision.remarks: Returns 0 if the precision of the underlying column type is not defined.

Scale.summary: Gets the scale of the column or parameter.
Scale.value: The scale of the column or parameter.
Scale.remarks: Returns 0 if the scale of the underlying column type is not defined.

SortOrder.summary: Returns the sort order for a column.

remarks.para: This property can only be set in one of the constructors.
For more information, see Table-Valued Parameters.

SortOrdinal.summary: Returns the ordinal of the sort column.
SortOrdinal.value: The ordinal of the sort column.

remarks.para: The default is 1.
This property can only be set in one of the constructors.
For more information, see Table-Valued Parameters.

SqlDbType.summary: Gets the data type of the column or parameter.
SqlDbType.value: The data type of the column or parameter as a .

Type.summary: Gets the common language runtime (CLR) type of user-defined type (UDT).
Type.value: The CLR type name of a user-defined type as a .

remarks.para: The default value is .
Returns if is not a UDT type. may also returned for valid UDT result sets where the assembly is not available to the application.

TypeName.summary: Gets the three-part name of the user-defined type (UDT) or the SQL Server type represented by the instance.
TypeName.value: The name of the UDT or SQL Server type as a .

UseServerDefault.summary: Reports whether this column should use the default server value.

remarks.para: The default is .
This property can only be set in one of the constructors.

XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase.summary: Gets the name of the database where the schema collection for this XML instance is located.
XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase.value: The name of the database where the schema collection for this XML instance is located as a .

remarks.para: The default value is .
This property may be if the collection is defined within the current database. It is also if there is no schema collection, in which case and are also .

XmlSchemaCollectionName.summary: Gets the name of the schema collection for this XML instance.
XmlSchemaCollectionName.value: The name of the schema collection for this XML instance as a .

remarks.para: The default value is .
This value is if there is no associated schema collection. If the value is , then and are also .

XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema.summary: Gets the owning relational schema where the schema collection for this XML instance is located.
XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema.value: The owning relational schema where the schema collection for this XML instance is located as a .

remarks.para: The default value is .
This value may be if the collection is defined within the current database and default schema. It is also null if there is no schema collection, in which case and are also .
